intro: Pimpinella vidalii, commonly known as the Vidal's茴香, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley, carrots, and celery. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
